summary: The document comprises records from the Assassination Records Review Board, focusing on the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. It details the employment of Beth Anne Lichtenfels as a Document Control Clerk, including her salary adjustments, a traumatic injury claim, and the handling of sensitive information such as Social Security numbers. These records are part of the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992, underscoring their historical relevance to the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination.
key_findings: Partial postponement of the document was due to the inclusion of Social Security numbers, with redactions implemented to safeguard personal privacy.
Beth Anne Lichtenfels served as a Document Control Clerk for the HSCA, initially earning a salary of $12,000.00, which was later increased to $14,000.
A traumatic injury claim form within the document outlines an injury Lichtenfels sustained while at work.
These records are categorized under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992, highlighting their importance in the historical investigation into President Kennedy's assassination.
